Context:
This table is about the section 1.1 System Requirements > Recommended System Requirements. 
Title: Recommended System Requirements 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = CPU; row 1, column 2 = Intel® Core i5 or higher; row 2, column 1 = Memory; row 2, column 2 = 16 Gbytes or more; row 3, column 1 = Operating System; row 3, column 2 = Windows 10 or higher; row 4, column 1 = Hard Disk space; row 4, column 2 = 3.5 Gbytes + Free space at least 2x the amount of data to be analyzed
table_html:
CPU Intel® Core i5 or higher
Memory 16 Gbytes or more
Operating System Windows 10 or higher
Hard Disk space 3.5 Gbytes + Free space at least 2x the amount of data to be analyzed

Context:
This table is about the section 1.1 System Requirements > System Minimum Requirements. 
Title: System Minimum Requirements 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = CPU; row 1, column 2 = Intel® Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz; row 2, column 1 = Memory; row 2, column 2 = 4 Gbytes; row 3, column 1 = Operating System; row 3, column 2 = Windows 8 or higher; row 4, column 1 = Hard Disk space; row 4, column 2 = 3.5 Gbytes + Free space at least 2x the amount of data to be analyzed
table_html:
CPU Intel® Core 2 Duo 2.4 GHz
Memory 4 Gbytes
Operating System Windows 8 or higher
Hard Disk space 3.5 Gbytes + Free space at least 2x the amount of data to be analyzed

Context:
This table is about the section 1.3 User Interface > Main Window. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Num.; row 1, column 2 = Window name; row 1, column 3 = Window name; row 1, column 4 = Description; row 2, column 1 = (1); row 2, column 2 = Menu; row 2, column 3 = Menu; row 2, column 4 = Creating/editing/saving project and files; row 3, column 1 = (2); row 3, column 2 = Node; row 3, column 3 = Node; row 3, column 4 = Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.; row 4, column 1 = (3); row 4, column 2 = ResourceWindow; row 4, column 3 = Resource Menu; row 4, column 4 = The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.; row 5, column 1 = (4); row 5, column 2 = ; row 5, column 3 = ResourceList; row 5, column 4 = The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.
table_html:
Num. Window name Description
(1) Menu Creating/editing/saving project and files
(2) Node Node for ‘Data’, ‘Chart’, “Modeling’, ‘Output’ and ‘Model Evaluation’. Data loading (data input), data manipulation to filter, derive variables and define indep. & dep. variables.
(3) ResourceWindow Resource Menu The resource window displays with Local, Model, and Output. Local displays the list of the current working folder. Model stores the current data analytical node. Output stores the results of executing the current project.
(4) ResourceList The window displays the contents of the selected menu (Local, Model, Output) in the Resource menu.
(5) Workspace Working space for data handling and model configuration
(6) Node Property Information for data and model specification and output at each node
(7) Message Log messages about errors and process information
(8) Dynamic Help The help for the node properties

Context:
This table is about the section 1.3 User Interface > 1.3.2 Node. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Classification; row 1, column 2 = Description; row 2, column 1 = Most used nodes; row 2, column 2 = Frequently used nodes. Add or exclude in ‘Most used nodes’ in Tool’s options; row 3, column 1 = Input Node; row 3, column 2 = Load data; row 4, column 1 = Preprocessing Node; row 4, column 2 = Data manipulation nodes for filtering, sorting, and splitting.; row 5, column 1 = Chart Node; row 5, column 2 = Graphics for data visualization
table_html:
Classification Description
Most used nodes Frequently used nodes. Add or exclude in ‘Most used nodes’ in Tool’s options
Input Node Load data
Preprocessing Node Data manipulation nodes for filtering, sorting, and splitting.
Chart Node Graphics for data visualization
Modeling Node Analytical techniques for prediction, classification, clustering, and AI algorithms
Output Node Save a DB or file
Model Evaluation Node Model evaluation, ROC chart

Context:
This table is about the section 1.3 User Interface > 1.3.8 Resource Window -Output > Output toolbar. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]
table_html: NOTE Since the output of the Display Node is generated as data, it should be saved as a data file(*.ecl) rather than as an output file (*.ept). Therefore, you must use the save button within the Display Node screen to save the output. [image:rId121]

Context:
This table is about the section 1.5 Shortcut key. 
Title: The shortcut key is shown in the table. F5 is for ‘execute’ and Ctrl & S is for ‘save’ and so on.

Title: The shortcut key is shown in the table. F5 is for ‘execute’ and Ctrl & S is for ‘save’ and so on.

Rows: row 21, column 1 = Alt + E, C; row 21, column 2 = Copy; row 21, column 3 = Alt + W; row 21, column 4 = Window; row 22, column 1 = Alt + E, P; row 22, column 2 = Paste; row 22, column 3 = Alt + W, C; row 22, column 4 = Cascade Alignment; row 23, column 1 = Alt + E, D; row 23, column 2 = Delete; row 23, column 3 = Alt + W, T; row 23, column 4 = Grid Alignment; row 24, column 1 = Alt + V; row 24, column 2 = View; row 24, column 3 = Alt + H; row 24, column 4 = Help; row 25, column 1 = Alt + V, T, M; row 25, column 2 = Message; row 25, column 3 = Alt + H, A; row 25, column 4 = ECMiner™ Info
table_html:
Shortcut function Shortcut function
Ctrl + N New Alt + V, T Toolbar
Ctrl + O Open Alt + V, T, S Standard Toolbar
Ctrl + S Save Alt + V, T, N Node
Ctrl + P Print Alt + V, T, P Node Properties
F5 Execute Alt + V, T, E Resource Window
Shift + F5 Stop Execution Alt + V, T, H Dynamic Help
Ctrl + F5 Part Execute Alt + V, S Status Bar
Alt + P Project Alt + V, E Data Browser
Alt + P, N New Alt + S Stream
Alt + P, O Open Alt + S, A Add Node
Alt + P, C Close Alt + S, C Connect Upon Creating Node
Alt + P, S Save Alt + S, N Connect
Alt + P, A Save As Alt + S, L Disconnect
Alt + P, P Print Alt + S, R Execute
Alt + P, V Print Preview Alt + S, S Stop Execution
Alt + P, R Print Setting Alt + S, N Part Execute
Alt + P, X Exit Alt + T Tool
Alt + E Edit Alt + T, O Option
Alt + E, T Cut Alt + T, I Initialize Program Environment
Alt + E, C Copy Alt + W Window
Alt + E, P Paste Alt + W, C Cascade Alignment
Alt + E, D Delete Alt + W, T Grid Alignment
Alt + V View Alt + H Help
Alt + V, T, M Message Alt + H, A ECMiner™ Info

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = [image:rId134] [image:rId135]; row 1, column 2 = Program Settings; row 1, column 3 = Set the program defaults for Date/Time Format, Reading Data, Designate File Extensions to Display on Resource Window, Program Look, etc.; row 2, column 1 = [image:rId136] [image:rId137]; row 2, column 2 = Default Database Setting; row 2, column 3 = Set the default driver and login information for ODBC or OLE DB.; row 3, column 1 = [image:rId138] [image:rId139]; row 3, column 2 = Edit Frequently Used Nodes; row 3, column 3 = You can add or delete the most used nodes.
table_html:
[image:rId134] [image:rId135] Program Settings Set the program defaults for Date/Time Format, Reading Data, Designate File Extensions to Display on Resource Window, Program Look, etc.
[image:rId136] [image:rId137] Default Database Setting Set the default driver and login information for ODBC or OLE DB.
[image:rId138] [image:rId139] Edit Frequently Used Nodes You can add or delete the most used nodes.

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings > 1.6.1 Program Settings. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Num.; row 1, column 2 = description; row 2, column 1 = (1); row 2, column 2 = You select the date/time display format based on the language.; row 3, column 1 = (2); row 3, column 2 = Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.; row 4, column 1 = (3); row 4, column 2 = Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.; row 5, column 1 = (4); row 5, column 2 = Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
table_html:
Num. description
(1) You select the date/time display format based on the language.
(2) Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.
(3) Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
(4) Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
(5) Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings > 1.6.1 Program Settings. 
Header candidates: row 1, column 1 = Num.; row 1, column 2 = description 
Rows: row 6, column 1 = (5); row 6, column 2 = Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.
table_html:
Num. description
(1) You select the date/time display format based on the language.
(2) Choose this option if you want to treat all numerical data as floating-point numbers when reading data.
(3) Specify the types of files to be displayed in the Resource window. Enter the file extensions you want to display, separated by ";". Extensions like ecm, ecl, ept, gms, etc., are selected by default even if not specified.
(4) Specify the overall look of the program. Set it to a form that is visually pleasing to the user.
(5) Specify the display format for floating-point numbers when presenting data on screen or in reports.

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings > 1.6.2 Default Database Setting. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Num.; row 1, column 2 = description; row 2, column 1 = (1); row 2, column 2 = Enter the database connection information for nodes related to OLE DB.; row 3, column 1 = (2); row 3, column 2 = Enter the database connection information for nodes related to ODBC.; row 4, column 1 = (3); row 4, column 2 = Selecting this option will automatically fill in the database connection information when adding nodes related to the database.
table_html:
Num. description
(1) Enter the database connection information for nodes related to OLE DB.
(2) Enter the database connection information for nodes related to ODBC.
(3) Selecting this option will automatically fill in the database connection information when adding nodes related to the database.

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings > 1.6.3 Edit Frequently Used Nodes. 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = Num.; row 1, column 2 = description; row 2, column 1 = (1); row 2, column 2 = All nodes supported by ECMiner™ are listed.; row 3, column 1 = (2); row 3, column 2 = (1) is used to add the selected node to "Most used nodes".; row 4, column 1 = (3); row 4, column 2 = To remove a node from "Most used nodes," select the node to be removed at (4) and press this button.; row 5, column 1 = (4); row 5, column 2 = This is the current list of nodes added to "Most used nodes."
table_html:
Num. description
(1) All nodes supported by ECMiner™ are listed.
(2) (1) is used to add the selected node to "Most used nodes".
(3) To remove a node from "Most used nodes," select the node to be removed at (4) and press this button.
(4) This is the current list of nodes added to "Most used nodes."

Context:
This table is about the section 1.6 Program Settings > 1.6.3 Edit Frequently Used Nodes > Function button. 
Title: Function button 
Rows: row 1, column 1 = icon; row 1, column 2 = function; row 2, column 1 = [image:rId143]; row 2, column 2 = Adds the selected node to the Most Used Nodes list.; row 3, column 1 = [image:rId144]; row 3, column 2 = Deletes the selected node from the Most Used Nodes list.
table_html:
icon function
[image:rId143] Adds the selected node to the Most Used Nodes list.
[image:rId144] Deletes the selected node from the Most Used Nodes list.
